description: Autodesk AutoCAD is a computer-aided design CAD ) application construction and design professionals utilize to create technical drawings. You can create various 2D and 3D drawings of industrial parts, buildings, vehicles, city streets, parks, furniture, and other items with AutoCAD.

Versions 1 to 14 of AutoCAD create BP2 (and .BPL files) files to allow you to save lists of files you commonly publish to printers or plotters. This helps you save time so you do not have to recreate the list of files each time you want to publish the same files or sheets.
NOTE: AutoCAD supported BP2 files up to version 14, then replaced BP2 files with .BP3 files.
